#summary Examples of calling the jQuery fillerup plugin
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy

=Add some HTML=

Add a single piece of content:

{{{
$('#col2').fillerup({
  alignWith:'#col1',
  content:'<p>Stuff to add</p>'
});
}}}

=Add an array of HTML=

Add an array of content:

{{{
$('#col2').fillerup({
  alignWith:'#col1',
  content:['<p>Stuff to add</p>','<div><img src="myimg.jpg"/>More stuff</div>']
});
}}}

=Call a function that adds content=

Call a function repeatedly to add content:

{{{
function addMoreContent(o) {
  $(this).append('<p>Stuff to add</p>');
}

$('#col2').fillerup({
  alignWith:'#col1',
  content:addMoreContent
});
}}}

=Call a function that adds content using AJAX=

Call a function repeatedly that uses AJAX to add content:

{{{
function addMoreContent(o) {

  var col = $(this);
  col.load('myurl.php', function(){ col.fillerup(o); });

  // Return false to stop from immediately calling the function again
  return false;
}

$('#col2').fillerup({
  alignWith:'#col1',
  content:addMoreContent
});
}}}

=Call a function that reveals hidden content=

Call a function repeatedly to reveal some content that is already hidden in column2:

{{{
function revealMoreContent(o) {
  $(this).children(':hidden').eq(0).show();
}

$('#col2').fillerup({
  alignWith:'#col1',
  content:revealMoreContent
});
}}}
